intro: Dracoscirpoides surculosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, it is considered an invasive species in some areas.
